body:
I just saw a [couple](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mg5BeeYGjY0) of [talks](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jvwfDdgg93E) on [this tool](http://hypothesis.works/) and I think it could be of use in stress testing certain aspects of spack, like:

- the parser
- the concretizer

Basically: it will generate random input for a test using a factory and will check that a set of invariants hold at the end of the test execution. It also registers the input for tests that fail in a DB so that they can always be re-tested from that point on. One way in which I can see this used is to code a factory that creates random syntactically valid specs and try to  parse a hundred of them each time we trigger the tool.
title: QA: hypothesis works
